Bootstrap 5 HTML Boilerplate.description: Basic HTML5 structure with Bootstrap 5 CDN links.

body: <button class="accordion-button" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#$2collapseOne" aria-expanded="true" aria-controls="$2collapseOne">

$4This is the first item’s accordion body. It is shown by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It’s also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#$5collapseTwo" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="$5collapseTwo">

$7This is the second item’s accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It’s also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#$8collapseThree" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="$8collapseThree">

$10This is the third item’s accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It’s also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.
Boostrap 5 Accordion.description: Bootstrap 5 Accordion component with three items.

body: <button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#$2flush-collapseOne" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="$2flush-collapseOne">
$4Placeholder content for this accordion, which is intended to demonstrate the .accordion-flush class. This is the first item’s accordion body.
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#$5flush-collapseTwo" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="$5flush-collapseTwo">

$7Placeholder content for this accordion, which is intended to demonstrate the .accordion-flush class. This is the second item’s accordion body. Let’s imagine this being filled with some actual content.
<button class="accordion-button collapsed" type="button" data-bs-toggle="collapse" data-bs-target="#$8flush-collapseThree" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="$8flush-collapseThree">

$10Placeholder content for this accordion, which is intended to demonstrate the .accordion-flush class. This is the third item’s accordion body. Nothing more exciting happening here in terms of content, but just filling up the space to make it look, at least at first glance, a bit more representative of how this would look in a real-world application.
Bootstrap 5 Accordion Flush.description: Bootstrap 5 Accordion with accordion-flush class and three items.
